Key Match Events: Bronny James and LeBron James became the first father-son duo to share the floor in an NBA game.
Anthony Davis recorded 36 points, 16 rebounds, 4 assists, and 3 blocks, taking over both ends of the court.
The Lakers led by 11 points with almost five minutes remaining in the fourth quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers defeated the Timberwolves 110-103 on the NBA's opening night of the regular season.
Bronny James made his NBA debut in the second quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Finch of the Timberwolves said, 'The season has started and we didnâ€™t answer the bell.'
JJ Redick, the Lakers' coach, said, 'I thought overall, our guys really did a phenomenal job of executing our game plan.'
Anthony Davis earned MVP chants late in the fourth quarter due to his dominant performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo made their regular season debuts for the Timberwolves.
Anthony Edwards led Minnesota in scoring with 27 points but shot 10-25 from the field.
